channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Lung cancer detection from thoracic CT scans using an ensemble of deep learning models
item.description: Our approach leverages deep transfer learning and adopts an ensemble learning approach.

item.title: Filling the Image Information Gap for VQA: Prompting Large Language Models to Proactively Ask Questions
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) demonstrate impressive reasoning ability and the maintenance of world knowledge not only in natural language tasks, but also in some vision-language tasks such as open-domain knowledge-based visual question answering (OK-VQA).

item.title: Entangled View-Epipolar Information Aggregation for Generalizable Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: Different from existing methods that consider cross-view and along-epipolar information independently, EVE-NeRF conducts the view-epipolar feature aggregation in an entangled manner by injecting the scene-invariant appearance continuity and geometry consistency priors to the aggregation process.

item.title: Taiyi: A Bilingual Fine-Tuned Large Language Model for Diverse Biomedical Tasks
item.description: However, most biomedical LLMs focus on enhancing performance in monolingual biomedical question answering and conversation tasks.

item.title: Causal Structure Learning Supervised by Large Language Model
item.description: Causal discovery from observational data is pivotal for deciphering complex relationships.

item.title: GPQA: A Graduate-Level Google-Proof Q&A Benchmark
item.description: We present GPQA, a challenging dataset of 448 multiple-choice questions written by domain experts in biology, physics, and chemistry.

item.title: Cross-View Graph Consistency Learning for Invariant Graph Representations
item.description: In this paper, we propose a cross-view graph consistency learning (CGCL) method that learns invariant graph representations for link prediction.

item.title: Establishing Central Sensitization Inventory Cut-off Values in patients with Chronic Low Back Pain by Unsupervised Machine Learning
item.description: The Central Sensitization Inventory (CSI) was developed to evaluate the presence of HACS, with a cut-off value of 40/100 based on patients with chronic pain.

item.title: SA-Med2D-20M Dataset: Segment Anything in 2D Medical Imaging with 20 Million masks
item.description: Segment Anything Model (SAM) has achieved impressive results for natural image segmentation with input prompts such as points and bounding boxes.

item.title: Real-Time Surface-to-Air Missile Engagement Zone Prediction Using Simulation and Machine Learning
item.description: Surface-to-Air Missiles (SAMs) are crucial in modern air defense systems.

item.title: LiDAR-HMR: 3D Human Mesh Recovery from LiDAR
item.description: In recent years, point cloud perception tasks have been garnering increasing attention.

item.title: Context-aware Neural Machine Translation for English-Japanese Business Scene Dialogues
item.description: We make use of Conditional Cross-Mutual Information (CXMI) to explore how much of the context the model uses and generalise CXMI to study the impact of the extra-sentential context.

item.title: LogLead -- Fast and Integrated Log Loader, Enhancer, and Anomaly Detector
item.description: The tool leverages Polars, a high-speed DataFrame library.

item.title: MILA: Memory-Based Instance-Level Adaptation for Cross-Domain Object Detection
item.description: A source sample is considered suitable if it differs from the target sample only in domain, without differences in unimportant characteristics such as orientation and color, which can hinder the modelâ€™s focus on aligning the domain difference.

item.title: Can we infer the presence of Differential Privacy in Deep Learning models' weights? Towards more secure Deep Learning
item.description: Thus, we face the challenge of determining whether a DL model has been trained with DP, according to the title question: Can we infer the presence of Differential Privacy in Deep Learning models' weights?

item.title: Igniting Language Intelligence: The Hitchhiker's Guide From Chain-of-Thought Reasoning to Language Agents
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have dramatically enhanced the field of language intelligence, as demonstrably evidenced by their formidable empirical performance across a spectrum of complex reasoning tasks.

item.title: AKConv: Convolutional Kernel with Arbitrary Sampled Shapes and Arbitrary Number of Parameters
item.description: In response to the above questions, the Alterable Kernel Convolution (AKConv) is explored in this work, which gives the convolution kernel an arbitrary number of parameters and arbitrary sampled shapes to provide richer options for the trade-off between network overhead and performance.

item.title: How well ChatGPT understand Malaysian English? An Evaluation on Named Entity Recognition and Relation Extraction
item.description: Malaysian English is unique as it exhibits morphosyntactic and semantical adaptation from local contexts.

item.title: Sparse Low-rank Adaptation of Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: Recognizing the need for more flexible adaptation, we extend the methodology of LoRA to an innovative approach we call sparse low-rank adaptation (SoRA) that enables dynamic adjustments to the intrinsic rank during the adaptation process.

item.title: KBioXLM: A Knowledge-anchored Biomedical Multilingual Pretrained Language Model
item.description: We achieve a biomedical multilingual corpus by incorporating three granularity knowledge alignments (entity, fact, and passage levels) into monolingual corpora.

item.title: Generalized Category Discovery in Semantic Segmentation
item.description: This paper explores a novel setting called Generalized Category Discovery in Semantic Segmentation (GCDSS), aiming to segment unlabeled images given prior knowledge from a labeled set of base classes.

item.title: Fuzzy Information Seeded Region Growing for Automated Lesions After Stroke Segmentation in MR Brain Images
item.description: Designed to effectively delineate the complex and irregular boundaries of stroke lesions, the FISRG algorithm combines fuzzy logic with Seeded Region Growing (SRG) techniques, aiming to enhance segmentation accuracy.

item.title: Estimation of entropy-regularized optimal transport maps between non-compactly supported measures
item.description: In the case that the target measure is compactly supported or strongly log-concave, we show that for a recently proposed in-sample estimator, the expected squared $L^2$-error decays at least as fast as $O(n^{-1/3})$ where $n$ is the sample size.

item.title: LQ-LoRA: Low-rank Plus Quantized Matrix Decomposition for Efficient Language Model Finetuning
item.description: Our approach uses an iterative algorithm to decompose each pretrained matrix into a high-precision low-rank component and a memory-efficient quantized component.

item.title: Risk-averse Batch Active Inverse Reward Design
item.description: I also integrated a risk-averse planner, similar to that of Inverse Reward Design (IRD), which samples a set of reward functions from the probability distribution and computes a trajectory that takes the most certain rewards possible.

item.title: CurriculumLoc: Enhancing Cross-Domain Geolocalization through Multi-Stage Refinement
item.description: Visual geolocalization is a cost-effective and scalable task that involves matching one or more query images, taken at some unknown location, to a set of geo-tagged reference images.

item.title: Training robust and generalizable quantum models
item.description: We derive tailored, parameter-dependent Lipschitz bounds for quantum models with trainable encoding, showing that the norm of the data encoding has a crucial impact on the robustness against perturbations in the input data.

item.title: Reti-Diff: Illumination Degradation Image Restoration with Retinex-based Latent Diffusion Model
item.description: These priors are subsequently utilized by RGformer to guide the decomposition of image features into their respective reflectance and illumination components.

item.title: Multi-Task Faces (MTF) Data Set: A Legally and Ethically Compliant Collection of Face Images for Various Classification Tasks
item.description: To address these issues, we present the Multi-Task Faces (MTF) image data set, a meticulously curated collection of face images designed for various classification tasks, including face recognition, as well as race, gender, and age classification.

item.title: Meta Prompting for AGI Systems
item.description: This paper presents an in-depth exploration of Meta Prompting, a novel technique that revolutionizes the way large language models (LLMs), multi-modal foundation models, and AI systems approach problem-solving and data interpretation.

item.title: NNG-Mix: Improving Semi-supervised Anomaly Detection with Pseudo-anomaly Generation
item.description: While AD is typically treated as an unsupervised learning task due to the high cost of label annotation, it is more practical to assume access to a small set of labeled anomaly samples from domain experts, as is the case for semi-supervised anomaly detection.

item.title: Identifying the Defective: Detecting Damaged Grains for Cereal Appearance Inspection
item.description: Cereal grain plays a crucial role in the human diet as a major source of essential nutrients.

item.title: Evil Geniuses: Delving into the Safety of LLM-based Agents
item.description: 3) the detection of the produced improper responses is more challenging.

item.title: Sparse4D v3: Advancing End-to-End 3D Detection and Tracking
item.description: We introduce two auxiliary training tasks (Temporal Instance Denoising and Quality Estimation) and propose decoupled attention to make structural improvements, leading to significant enhancements in detection performance.

item.title: Exploring Prompting Large Language Models as Explainable Metrics
item.description: This paper describes the IUST NLP Lab submission to the Prompting Large Language Models as Explainable Metrics Shared Task at the Eval4NLP 2023 Workshop on Evaluation & Comparison of NLP Systems.

item.title: TextGuard: Provable Defense against Backdoor Attacks on Text Classification
item.description: In this work, we propose TextGuard, the first provable defense against backdoor attacks on text classification.

item.title: LucidDreamer: Towards High-Fidelity Text-to-3D Generation via Interval Score Matching
item.description: The recent advancements in text-to-3D generation mark a significant milestone in generative models, unlocking new possibilities for creating imaginative 3D assets across various real-world scenarios.

item.title: A Universal Framework for Accurate and Efficient Geometric Deep Learning of Molecular Systems
item.description: Molecular sciences address a wide range of problems involving molecules of different types and sizes and their complexes.

item.title: Evidential Uncertainty Quantification: A Variance-Based Perspective
item.description: Uncertainty quantification of deep neural networks has become an active field of research and plays a crucial role in various downstream tasks such as active learning.

item.title: Optimal Locally Private Nonparametric Classification with Public Data
item.description: In this work, we investigate the problem of public data-assisted non-interactive LDP (Local Differential Privacy) learning with a focus on non-parametric classification.

item.title: Addressing the speed-accuracy simulation trade-off for adaptive spiking neurons
item.description: The adaptive leaky integrate-and-fire (ALIF) model is fundamental within computational neuroscience and has been instrumental in studying our brains $\textit{in silico}$.

item.title: Unmasking and Improving Data Credibility: A Study with Datasets for Training Harmless Language Models
item.description: Given the cost and difficulty of cleaning these datasets by humans, we introduce a systematic framework for evaluating the credibility of datasets, identifying label errors, and evaluating the influence of noisy labels in the curated language data, specifically focusing on unsafe comments and conversation classification.

item.title: A Cross-Attention Augmented Model for Event-Triggered Context-Aware Story Generation
item.description: These results underscore the effectiveness of our model in leveraging context and event features to improve the quality of generated narratives.

item.title: Tensor-Aware Energy Accounting
item.description: At the heart of Smaragdine is a novel white-box methodology of energy accounting: Smaragdine is aware of the internal structure of the DL program, which we call tensor-aware energy accounting.

item.title: LABCAT: Locally adaptive Bayesian optimization using principal component-aligned trust regions
item.description: Bayesian optimization (BO) is a popular method for optimizing expensive black-box functions.

item.title: FedRA: A Random Allocation Strategy for Federated Tuning to Unleash the Power of Heterogeneous Clients
item.description: The implementation of FedRA is straightforward and can be seamlessly integrated into any transformer-based model without the need for further modification to the original model.

item.title: Pair-wise Layer Attention with Spatial Masking for Video Prediction
item.description: To this end, we present a Pair-wise Layer Attention with Spatial Masking (PLA-SM) framework for video prediction to capture the spatiotemporal dynamics, which reflect the motion trend.

item.title: Negotiated Representations for Machine Mearning Application
item.description: Overfitting is a phenomenon that occurs when a machine learning model is trained for too long and focused too much on the exact fitness of the training samples to the provided training labels and cannot keep track of the predictive rules that would be useful on the test data.

item.title: Appearance Codes using Joint Embedding Learning of Multiple Modalities
item.description: The use of appearance codes in recent work on generative modeling has enabled novel view renders with variable appearance and illumination, such as day-time and night-time renders of a scene.

item.title: CHAMP: Efficient Annotation and Consolidation of Cluster Hierarchies
item.description: Various NLP tasks require a complex hierarchical structure over nodes, where each node is a cluster of items.
